instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P5VS0_EN: What is P5VS0_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_S0 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.P5VS0_EN_L: What is P5VS0_EN_L? P5VS0_EN_L is a signal that enables the PP5V_S0 5v power rail when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message:
I have a macbook which dont go on.
available rails are pp3v42, ppbusbus, s5 and s0 but no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>. i already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7940</TRANSISTOR> but no result. enable signal is also available diode reading on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> is 0.409. power supply hangs on 0.089 amps. I am new to macbook logicboard repair and any help is much appriciated. it is my learning board so i can experiment on it.

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message:
I assume your board is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>; confirm if I'm wrong.

Do you have all S3 voltages and also 3V at =<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL>?
In such case, post <SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>P5VS0_SS</SIGNAL> level voltage.

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message:
Hi there,

Thank you for response, it is indeed the same board. i have checked the voltages, <SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 5.02v and <SIGNAL>P5VS0_SS</SIGNAL> is 4.95. i also measured other s0 power rails enable they are all present. what i find strange is that <RESISTOR>R7859</RESISTOR> and  <RESISTOR>R7879</RESISTOR> supposed to be 100k resistence but it is not. i checked another board same results. <RESISTOR>R7879</RESISTOR> is 22k resistor on the boards.

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 5.02v"
No good; ending _L means signal active low (with 0V)...

"3V at =<SIGNAL>P5VS0_EN</SIGNAL>?"
???

When you measure resistor onboard, other components can make the value lower.

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message:
Ohhh so <SIGNAL>P5VSO_EN_L</SIGNAL> should be zero?
<SIGNAL>P5VSO_EN</SIGNAL> is indeed 3v.

threads.title: MacBook 820-279-b
threads.message: i am sorry i was wrong, just tested it again no enable signal which ofcourse come from processor I am gonna stop with this board. Thank you for your guidence.
